text:
by default it should be

```{% for content in contents %}
...
{% endfor %}```
it will work in the blog listing template.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/blog#blog-listing-for-loop>


But you could create your own listing logic with
```set blog_posts = blog_recent_posts('blog-ID', NUMBER)

{% for post in blog_posts %}
...
{% endfor %}```
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#blog-recent-posts>

I’ve run into a roadblock, and I’ve thought myself in circles trying to figure it out. I have a custom blog listing template I am trying to use with a Starter Portal, but it will not show as available in the change template selection screen. I have this at the top, like every other blog listing page I’ve ever made.
```<!--
  templateType: blog_listing
  isAvailableForNewContent: true
  label:  Blog Listing
-->

{% extends "../layouts/base.html" %}```
Is this a limitation with Starter Portals?
